reviews.review: Very good game apart from the very fustrating boss fight half way through the game. The DLC is a must buy for fans of the first bioshock
Would be confused by the story again 10/10

In der Haut des ex-Pinkerton Agents Booker Dewitt schie√üen und zaubern wir uns durch die leicht schlauchige aber dennoch frei wirkende fantastische Welt von Bioshock Infinite. Wir treffen auf unterschiedliche Gegner die mit besonderen F√§higkeiten (Firemen, Patriot, Handymen oder andere) oder unterschiedlichen Waffen. Die tats√§chlich Fantastische Spielwelt von Bioshock Infinite ist gespickt von Nutzbaren Dingen, die einem den Kampf erleichtern. Die sogenannte Skyline (eine Art von Gleis bei der man sich an einem Haken durch die L√ºfte schwingt oder die Risse die, die fr√ºh im Spiel vorkommende Begleiterin Elizabeth (die uns auch fast das ganze Spiel lang begleitet) √∂ffnen kann. Damit werden Selbsschussanlagen, √ñllachen(f√ºr den Feuerzauber wichtig), fliegende mini Helikopter mit MG usw. herbeigerufen. Au√üerdem kann unsere Begleiterin uns immer mal wieder mit geld Munition Medipacks usw. versorgen. 
Die Story des Spiels ist sehr verworren und der eigentlich simple Auftrag Elizabeth zu "Befreien" wird schnell zu einer actiongeladenen und so komplizierten Geschichte, dass die Figuren oft selber nicht mitkommen. Sofern man aber die im Spiel verteilten Audiologs sich anh√∂rt kann man mit etwas Fantasie die Geschichte nachvollziehen. Trotzalledem lebt das Spiel von der Story, da diese gut ist und den Spieler fesselt. Da dies so ist werde ich in diesem Bereich nichts mehr sagen, da kleine Details schon spoilern k√∂nnten. Die Spielwelt √ºberzeugt mit wahnsinnig gutem Setting und an sich stimmigen Leveldesign. Man muss zugeben dass die schwebende Stadt Columbia Stoff f√ºr sehr sch√∂ne Screenshots gibt. Das einzige was mir nicht gefiel war die kurze Spielzeit. Je nach Spielstil habt ihr das Spiel innerhalb von 7-10 sunden durchgespielt.

Story:  9/10 -gute aber teilweise verwirrende Story

Gameplay: 10/10 -Das zusammenspiel aus Waffen, F√§higkeiten, der Skyline und den Rissen macht einfach Spa√ü

Spielwelt: 11/10: wahnsinnig sch√∂ne und stimmige Spielwelt, √ºberahl sind Ausblicke die einem die Kinnlade runterklapen l√§sst

Grafik: 8/10: Selbstverst√§ndlich f√ºr 2015 nicht so gute Grafik aber die sch√∂ne Spielwelt √ºberzeugt auch ohne Grafik a la Witcher 3

Ich kann einer Person, die Singleplayershooter mag und gerne in eine sch√∂ne Spielwelt und guter Spielwelt abtaucht und Besch√§ftigung f√ºr 8-10 Stunden sucht w√§rmstens empfehlen

One of the more interesting games I've played.  Visited a city and was quickly accepted despite being an outsider.  After winning a contest, I was labeled the equivalent of the anti-christ and went on a rampage because, why not?  After saving a young woman who could could wish upon a star, I soon battled George Washington.  After defeating him, I was able to summon this great leader to fight along my side with his patriotic minigun.  As proud Americans, all of us should purchase this game.  It is what our founding fathers would have wanted.

A very good story and setting, but the fighting doesn't become different from your typical shooter experience until half-way through when the skylines and tears are present. Also, I prefer being able to carry more than two guns such as in the previous Bioshocks, where the upgrades also felt like they mattered and one gun wasn't just better than the rest (the carbine in this case). There was actually incentive to use a pistol in Bioshock 1 as other weapon weapon ammo was scarce. This combat is much more fast-paced and modern.

A good first person shooter. Graphics, story, ambientation, and mechanics are quite good, and maybe presents the more smarter and helpfull companion to date: Elizabeth. But a lineal maps, the limited freedom to explore, restriction to save, and absence of secondary missions prevent that be better; requires a powerfull hardware to run at high quality levels. The arena downloable content is fun for a short while; the other two are downgrades of previous titles. As the main campaing feels some short, recommend to buy with higher discount possible.

A great game, the story and world is amazing. Combat is very mediocre, the music is also great. Bioshock Infinite's main positives are the world and story. That being said I would still recommend playing it just for the story. Combat is very boring though so be prepared for that.
Entertaining, intense, thought provoking...beautifully crafted like a piece of fine art.  The ending will leave you with goose-bumps.  The DLC is well worth it.  A masterpiece of the FPS genre.

Bioshock is a game that I was always put off from playing because I felt it just wasnt for me... Now that I look back I relize at how much of an idiot I was because after recently playing this game I can confidently say it is one of the best games I have ever had the pleasure of playing. 

There are no words to describe it, just play it and you will see.
Im not a FPS gammer but the storyline is REALLY amazing! Worth it 11/10

One of the best games with a twisting story! I've read somewhere in the comments, that it could be the Plot-twist Simulator 2015. Couldn't agree more!
10/10 storywise and 10/10 as a pure clever FPS.

I would not recommend this. The plot was terrible, the script worse, the ending was dumb and anticlamtic and the controls were annoying. Not to mention it threw far too many 'plot twists' at you, the graphics weren't very good and the ending itself made your entire storyline redundant - it's like a child writing a story and saying 'and then he woke up and it was all a dream'. The first Bioshock is one of my favourite games to date, and this is just... awful. Wasted three days on this that I'm never going to get back. I could go on forever about how bad it is but I would end up swearing too much. Just don't bother with it. Play the first one instead, it's fantastic.
It's as good as they say it is. The discriptions are not exaggerated at all.
Straight out, THE BEST SINGELPLAYER GAME ON PC! Hope they make a sequel

I'd heard a lot of bad things about this game (poor story, poor fighting/weaponry implementation, style over substance etc., ). I have to say I really enjoyed it. Bought it on Steam sale at a lovely price. It looks great, i thought it played great. Thoroughly enjoyed.

Just buy this game its a really great game the combat does not complament the story, however this is one the greatest game ever! I got emotional durring this game which is hard do with me. ALL I HAVE TO SAY IS BUY THIS GAME AFTER PLAYING BIOSHOCK 1 AND 2!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
just a basic fps mostly, the story wasn't good enough to make up for the average gameplay.  Alos the random difficulty spikes were annoying to say the least.

I've seen many people give it 9/10 but I honestly think this game deserves the 10/10 spot.

This game really gives players the old and futuristic atmosphere that wanted. I've played other Bioshock games too, but i didn't like any of them as Bioshock Infinite. It is better than i expected and definitely worth it.
 Also; I think i'm in love with Elizabeth.

Very engaging so much so I found myself thanking Elizabeth from time to time for assistance.  Made even more enjoyable as I played it over July 4th weekend.  The environment is beautiful with just the right amount of expansiveness.  All characters were engaging and I truely cared what happened to Elizabeth.  The ending was phenomenal.  My only quibbles were 1) I found that I had to replay segments (not really an issue) because I had to leave and the last autosave was 10+ minutes previous to where i had to quit (or maybe the future?).  2) The game I guess didn't want me to stop so a few times it froze on exiting to windows where only task manager would shut it down.  It was an amazing experience and I feel compelled to give it another go with different weapons and powers.

Excellent experience, great game with wonderfully intregate story. 
I love it!

My all time favourite game. It has everything a video game should have to ensure an experience the player will never forget; plentiful action scenes, characters that players grow to love and care for throughout the game and a story which makes you yearn to continue playing. 

My favourite aspects of this game are simply exploring the wonderful and beautiful world of Columbia, finding all the Voxophones and discovering the story. I enjoy how this game, as well as Bioshock 1 and 2, doesn't give you the entire story but allows the player to piece together the wider story for themselves. To flesh out the bones presented to you.

It's characters are amazing. Booker and Elizabeth grow on the player the more you go through the game, to the point where you physically care about them by the end. They both grow as people, as they travel through Columbia's floating streets, and so do you as the player. They make you laugh, cry and, most importantly, think. Comstock remains a mystery, even after the game ends but he still remains a powerful force in the game. But by far the greatest characters in this entire game are the Lutece twins, Robert and Rosalind, they are both omniscient guides and odd comic relief.

The game play is smooth and easy to master, on both keyboard and mouse and controller. You never feel like you're doing finger contortionism while playing, like other games on the market.

 This game is a must play, for everyone who loves amazing storylines and griping character. Buy this game, buy it now!

Yes, of course "Infinite" is brilliant.

It ups the ante on everything from "BioShock" and "BioShock2." The combat is more intense and happens more often, but there are also longish stretches where you can just take in all the world-building that Irrational did. Has done. Will do. (You'll get it later.) The balance between the two "loops" is handled very well, and I never quit the game because I was bored - a big improvement over the first game in the series.

The narrative elements are deftly done, with lots of little details that will, at turns, make you smile at the connections and in-jokes, wince at the applicability to what's happening now in the USA, and utterly horrify you later on. Also, the ending payoff is HUGE, delivered in-game, and will PUNCH YOU IN THE FACE.

Oh, and the Lutece's are some of the best and most engaging "kinda-secondary" characters I've ever encountered.

My only complaint was with the sound - specifically, the sound mix for the dialogue. It's not that the dialogue sounds bad, but rather that (at certain points), bits of character speech would get run over by all the cacaphony of Hollywood sound effects. The gist of things always came through, but a little more space for speech would have been nice (especially because the dialogue is so important). Part of the intensity of the game is in how loud it seems to be, and that's fine - but there's a point where it gets in its own way.

But that's a minor quibble. "Infinite" is very close to perfect.

Very great story and awesome mechanics for fighting. Hours of fun, another fun game that I enjoyed to no end:)
IGN/10
Overated. Mediocre gameplay, trite story, poor execution all round. Haven't been this dissapointed by a game since Heavy Rain.

Love this game. Runs flawless on my arch linux on 1080 resolution.
Love the story, love the voices, love the gameplay.

Bom , este jogo √© uma obra de arte , quando esta jogando at√© parece um filme.
Os personagens s√£o carismaticos , principalmente Elizabeth que √© uma das mulheres mais fodonas que ja vi em games , no come√ßo quando voc√™ tem a miss√£o de levar ela para nova york , logo de cara voc√™ pensa no resident evil 4 , onde tinha aquela menina dependente do krl e s√≥ te dava trabalho .
Mas a Elizabeth √© completamente independente e pelo contrario , ela te ajuda muito , muitas vezes quase morri e ela me salvou. Trilha sonora do game √© magnifica e o jogo tem sim seus momentos tensos , assim como os antecessores , mas esses momentos s√£o mais pro final do game .
Recomendo zerar os 2 anteriores para entender melhor o final do jogo que √© brilhante e totalmente imprevisivel.
Vai por mim , se voc√™ zerar ele antes dos antecessores √© provavel que n√£o queira zerar nenhum deles , pois este √© de longe o melhor da trilogia , tanto em enredo , historia , jogabilidade e final.
Ent√£o zere os outros antes !!!! kkkk, brincadeiras a parte , o jogo √© espetacular e √© obrigatorio pra quem quer jogar a trilogia "Bioshock".
Neste Bioshock voc√™ n√£o √© t√£o dependente dos "Vigores" que seriam os "Plasmideos" nos atecessores , aqui voc√™ tem armas √≥timas que quando s√£o upadas no maximo , te deixam meio que invensivel se souber usa-las.
Sobre os bugs , neste Bioshock n√£o vi nenhum , √© serio . Pra quem leu minha analise do "Biochock 1" ou "Bioshock Original" sabe que tanto ele quando o 2 eram cheios de bugs de DX (DirectX) e se este tamb√©m fosse , quem jogasse tava ferrado por que ele n√£o √© como os outros que tem save aonde e quando quer, o save dele √© automatico e √© na nuvem :).

Pr√≥s - Jogabilidade
        - Enredo
        - Historia
        - Personagens carismaticos
        - Trilha sonora
        - Final surpreendente
        
Contras - Campanha curta
              - Facilidade na campanha
yes
Buy. Play. Cry. 10/10 would cry again

My opinion for this game is a... complicated one, so if you don't care for specifics, just take it as positive.

As someone that has been a diehard fan of the Bioshock series ever since its conception, I can't consider this game an addition to the series, and not because it's not (primarily) set in Rapture, but because it doesn't hold any common ground with any game containing "shock" that was headed by Ken Levine.

The weapons, unlike its predecessors, are lackluster and dull, with the majority of them being useless, or phased out by far more viable guns (try finding some footage of this game where somebody isn't just using the carbine and hand cannon).

The "tonics" by far feel like the weakest thing about the game, with all but 2-3 of them feeling worthless, and unlike the other games, the use for them to access secret areas containing additional audio logs and loot are very sparse.

Now, for the additional game mechanics.

The lockpick "system" (if you can bare over glorifying this poorly-implemented gimmick to call it that) is atrocious, and because they couldn't be fucked to think of a new hacking minigame, they just added the occasional safe or door that requires the use of your precious and rare "lockpicks" to find out whether or not you just got screwed over because you spent all of them opening a door to reveal some ammo that you already maxxed out on, you may see a safe up ahead that requires only 2 and without a shadow of a doubt holds some of the best loot in the game. All in all, barely thought-out and dissapointing.

The Elizabeth system is trivial and dumb, and they only put it in to make the game not seem like an escort quest. The level design could have been exactly the same and it would've been fine if they just implemented the occasional hook every here-and-there, and would actually encourage the player to fan out further in order to find supplies.

Sidequests- eh.

The skyrails were very well done, but incredibly underused, and just came across as another gimmick to be used in a level every now-and-then.

The story? Alot of people harp on about how this game has an excellent tale, with a strong supporting lore, but I would heavily disagree, even the background story provided through audio logs in Bioshock 2 (The strongest and most underrated aspect of that game, by the way) is more solid and integral than that of this game. The multi-dimensional aspect of the story is mind-mushingly simple, especially considering what they could've done with it, and I feel that it is an insult to the saga, and a disappointment after Minerva's Den for 2. Another nitpick is that when Elizabeth is supposedly depressed and undergoing complete psychological trauma, she still has it in her to yell a whimsical comment as she throws you some ammo or picks a lock. The alleged and critically acclaimed "twists" in it feel incredibly predictible.

Character Progression- Tonics get really dull and uninteresting upgrades. There is no system similar to that of the Little Sisters. The weapon upgrades dullness is second only to that of the weapons themselves. You can only hold 2 weapons. The only remnants of the moral choice system showcased in the original display of the early version of this game is at the very beginning, and has no impact at all.

As much as I've been harping on it, this is still a good game. Just not a good -----Shock game. Although many of these issues are fixed the Burial at Sea expansion pack, they still aren't part of the base game, which is by far what really counts. I thoroughly recommend this game, though you may want to pick it up at a discount...

[h1]Bioshock Infinite[/h1]
Is one of the weirdest ending games and awesome at the same time... 
The story is incredibly well done with all the easter eggs of the previous bioshock games, with an incredible gameplay especially with all plasmids, if you are planning to buy this game, you should play bioshock and bioshock 2 and if you just want to get into the awesome bioshock story buy the 2 episodes of burial at sea. It was an amazing experience playing the game. Definitely in my favorite games list, definitely a must buy, definitely a masterpiece.
10/10

I could not get into the previsous Bioshock games, but this one I really enjoyed.  The atmosphere is great.  Not much more that I can say other than you should pick this up if you like a good FPS with a different type of play than your standard shooter.  If you find it on sale, even better!

When Bioshock infinite first came out I assumed it was a moneygrab. "A bioshock in the sky? thats just stupid?". Oh how was I wrong. Extremely fun combat, althought I found myself using my guns over my Vigors all the time. But most of all, the entire game and its story is surprisingly unique, and different. 

(NOT spoilers) The ending is confusing, but once you understand it, it was a fantastic story, and it all really comes together is one huge moment in the end. It took 9-10 hours to complete the entire story, and I do feel it is one of those "play it once" games with low replay value, although on sale for $7.50 this is one of, if not my best sale purchases on steam, it was an extremely enjoyable 10 hours of gameplay.

If your on the edge about trying this game, try it. Also keep in mind you really dont need to have played the previous 2 bioshock games although there is a pretty cool scene in the end referring to the old games.
Mi juego favorito ;)

in other words. BRILLIANT GAME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This is one on The most fun games i've ever played i recommend it 11/10 :D Buy and play

i wondered if this game lights a cigarette after the mindfucking me.

I clearly do not enjoy this game. Not because it's a shooter, but how awful its components of visuals, shooter mechanics, storytelling and side powers of the player are assembled together.

Wouldn't recommend to anyone who dislikes grinding in games. Even a good story doesn't deserve such tormenting gameplay.
Such a beautiful city columbia is. This is a very well made game.
A masterpiece in story-telling and overall gameplay

Oltre ad essere il pi√π emozionante dei 3 capitoli, merita assolutamente di essere giocato per la complessa trama (in cui giocano un ruolo determinante le registrazioni sparse nel gioco) e soprattutto per il sorprendente finale, che lo rendono un piccolo capolavoro. Ambientazione fenomenale, da vivere in ogni suo curatissimo dettaglio. Gioco che difficilmente dimenticherete!

Well I thought it will be just an usual action game, but when I started the game, I was totally wrong. 

This game is one of a kind, great story, great environment, and every time you smoke em' dudes with that crazy hand gun is very pleasing, the so-called "Vigor" are very great and very cool to use everytime you meet a bunch of em' bad guys.

Obra maestra.

Really great game. Pretty standard control/playstyle having the default zoom key set to 'z' was a bit of a issue, but I moved it to a shortcut on my mouse which worked great. The best part of this game however is the story. Definitely recommend trying even if you've never played Bioshock before it would be okay if this is the only one you play.
Bioshock I and II were among the best solo FPS experience I had, Bioshock infinite continue the tradition but doesn't really bring anything new, still a lot of fun though!

Wow.  Just wow.  I played and enjoyed the first two Bioshock games, but always felt they recieved a bit more credit than they deserved.  Bioshock Infinite makes the previous games feel like prototypes; this is a true marvel in game design and storytelling.

The combat may not be groundbreaking (you now have a regenerating shield ala Halo), but it's brutal, every weapon and tonic in the game is varied and useful, and for the first time in the series it's just plain fun.  That doesn't mean it's now a mindless shooter; the multi-layered, biting, emotional narrative makes just about every other video game plot look like amateur hour.  The highlight is Elizabeth, one of the best written and useful companions to ever grace a game; she'll toss you ammo and health in the middle of a fight, open tears to another dimension to turn the odds in your favor, pick locks for you, never needs babysitting, and quips, "Oh my god!" when you grind your skyhook into some poor sap's face.  She's awesome.

I won't get into plot specifics, partially to avoid spoilers (the less you know going in the better), and partially because I couldn't even begin to do it justice without breaking the game down scene by scene and analizing every visual cue and line of dialogue, and I'd probably need a degree in quantum physics.  It can be enjoyed and absorbed on a multitude of levels, from a simple father/daughter parable to the dark history of The United States to the folly of Patriotism and Absolutism, and a whole lot beyond and between.  I really cannot reccommend this enough; it's so finely crafted and carries so much weight I'd tell anyone who doesn't even like games in general to buckle in and experience something special.  It's just so good.

*Quick note about the DLC: long story short it's not that good.  I played the arena stuff when it first came out and was nothing special.  Burial at Sea is a two part story that ties Columbia and Rapture together, but really it just dilutes and over-complicates what really didn't need explaination.  The first part returns to the well of Rapture and it's pretty standard, but ends right when it gets going.  The second part has you playing as Elizabeth, which going by the main story should be amazing... but it's not.  It's poorly done stealth with no other options, and quite frankly it's boring.  Unless you get it in a bundle for dirt cheap, just don't bother.  Even then it might not even be worth the time and the bad taste it leaves in your mouth after the mindblowing main game.
